primary_categories.name: Antisemitic Ideology
primary_categories.description: Educational content countering calls for annihilation, conspiracy theories, or portraying Jewish people as evil

primary_categories.name: Stereotypes and Dehumanization
primary_categories.description: Educational content countering economic stereotypes, biological racism, or humiliating external imaging of Jewish people

primary_categories.name: Indirect Antisemitism
primary_categories.description: Educational content countering mentions of Jewish/Israeli public figures with antisemitic implications

detailed_scores.reasoning: The document does not directly address general hate or discrimination, but it does provide information about how antisemites use the concept of "109 expulsions" to perpetuate harmful stereotypes and prejudices against Jewish people.
The document provides information about how antisemites use the figure of 109 expulsions to promote conspiracy theories and harmful ideologies, which is a common tactic used by white supremacists.
The document highlights how antisemites use the figure of 109 expulsions to perpetuate stereotypes and dehumanize Jewish people, which is a common tactic used by bigots.

The document does not directly address anti-Israel or anti-Zionist narratives, but it does provide information about how antisemites use the figure of 109 expulsions to promote harmful stereotypes and prejudices against Jewish people.

The document does not directly address Holocaust denial or minimization, but it does provide information about how antisemites use the figure of 109 expulsions to perpetuate harmful stereotypes and prejudices against Jewish people.
The document highlights how antisemites use the figure of 109 expulsions to target Jewish public figures with indirect antisemitic messages, which is a common tactic used by bigots.
